thread.title: Foundation day of Tanda college

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Foundation day of Tanda college
text:
Our Correspondent
Kangra, October 23
A function was held on the foundation day of Dr Rajendra Prasad Government Medical College, Tanda, today. Principal Dr Anil Chauhan said the foundation stone of the hospital was laid by Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh in 1996. He said the institution ranked 19th in the country. Chauhan said the hospital had 593 beds and that 100 MBBS, 48 MD/MS, 30 nursing and 30 BSC paramedical students were enrolled every year. He said the super-specialty block had also been opened and 209 more beds were added. Chauhan said the government had approved the department of emergency medicine. â€œThe institution has excelled in the fields of research, education and patient care. It will be fully computerised by the end of next year with end-mile connectivity, dedicated data centre, PACS and hospital management information systems. The students offered fruits to patients.
